headline.main: The Great Billiard Match at Detroit--A Match between Dudley Kavanagh and Michael Foley--The Sporting Clubs of Detroit, &c., &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: The arrangements for the great billiard match, to be played in this city on Tuesday the 12th inst., are being rapidly and harmoniously perfected. Mr. PERLAN arrived here last Friday, and is in fine health and spirits, and in excellent playing conditions. SEEREITER, his competitor, is equally well prepared for the contest, and the friends of each party are anxious for the trial.

docs.snippet: General News from the Central American States. By the arrival of the steamship Star of the West, from Aspinwall, we have received very late and important intelligence from Central America. The subjoined letters from our correspondents give a full...

headline.main: IMPORTANT FROM CENTRAL AMERICA.; Reported Ratification of the Cass-Yrissari Treaty. Rejection of the Belly Grant.

docs.lead_paragraph: General News from the Central American States. By the arrival of the steamship Star of the West, from Aspinwall, we have received very late and important intelligence from Central America. The subjoined letters from our correspondents give a full summary of the latest news.

docs.snippet: A letter from Rome says: "An anecdote which was recently related to me shows in another form how averse the Papal Government is from letting too much light into the public mind. The gas-pipes in the Plazza del Popolo were being examined not many...
docs.lead_paragraph: A letter from Rome says: "An anecdote which was recently related to me shows in another form how averse the Papal Government is from letting too much light into the public mind. The gas-pipes in the Plazza del Popolo were being examined not many mornings since, when a stranger observed, 'So you are letting in light upon the Popolo.'

docs.snippet: In a part of our first edition of yesterday morning, the arrival of the screw-steamship City of Baltimore, from Liverpool on the 30th of March, was announced. The news by this arrival is not of signal importance.
docs.lead_paragraph: In a part of our first edition of yesterday morning, the arrival of the screw-steamship City of Baltimore, from Liverpool on the 30th of March, was announced. The news by this arrival is not of signal importance.

docs.snippet: The bills to provide for the completion of the New-York Arsenal; to settle the disputed Connect-out boundary; to authorize the reduction of the capital stock of Banking Associations; to protect gas consumers, and to provide a monument to the...
docs.lead_paragraph: The bills to provide for the completion of the New-York Arsenal; to settle the disputed Connect-out boundary; to authorize the reduction of the capital stock of Banking Associations; to protect gas consumers, and to provide a monument to the Walls-bout martyrs, were all ordered to a third reading.

headline.main: LAW REPORTS.; COURT CALENDAR SUPERIOR COURT COURT OF COMMON PLEAS. SUPREME COURT UNITED STATES CIRCUIT COURT Trial of Quimbo Appo, the chinaman, for the Murder of Mrs. Fisteher. COURT OF OYER AND TERMINER.

docs.snippet: The mails from Europe by steamship Canada, at Boston, on Saturday night, reached the New-York Post-Office yesterday morning. To the telegraphic abstract we add letters and extracts of unusual interest. OUR LONDON CORRESPONDENCE.

headline.main: EUROPE.; Additional from European Files and Correspondence. Arrival of the Mails by the Canada.

docs.lead_paragraph: The mails from Europe by steamship Canada, at Boston, on Saturday night, reached the New-York Post-Office yesterday morning. To the telegraphic abstract we add letters and extracts of unusual interest. OUR LONDON CORRESPONDENCE.

headline.main: AFFAIRS AT ALBANY,; Prospects of the City Railroads--Dubious Position of the Charter--The Compromise Wharfage Bill--Office of Inspector of Vessels not to be Abolished--The Brooklyn Water Bill Amended --The Sewerage Bill Passed the House, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: The lobby now, like despairing States, looks to the Senate, All yesterday, but especially last evening, the crowd went up to look at it. The ;reference of the City Railroads was the first question of interest, which at last was settled by sending them to the Committee on Cities and villages.

docs.snippet: Among the many noble Charitable Institutions which are found in the City of New York, there is none which presents more urgent claims on the good will and support of the public than the "Woman's Hospital Association,"--and there is none, certainly,...
docs.lead_paragraph: Among the many noble Charitable Institutions which are found in the City of New York, there is none which presents more urgent claims on the good will and support of the public than the "Woman's Hospital Association,"--and there is none, certainly, more in need of its liberal patronage.
